main event: A ball of fire was sighted heading south over Dayton, Ohio on June 10, 1956 at 2155 EST.
interesting points: The object was reported by an 11-year-old boy and investigated by the U.S. Air Force.
The Air Force concluded the object was likely an outdoor flare or overflying jet, but there was insufficient data for a definitive evaluation.
The witness had reported seeing a similar object in the area a few months earlier, in March or April 1956.
The report includes a detailed questionnaire about the witness's observations, including details about the sky conditions, brightness of the object, and its movements.
No photographs were included with the report.
